name: execute-read-command
description:
Execute a read-only CLI command. Use discover-commands first to find the right command.

When to use this tool vs query:
- Use `query` tool for bulk data retrieval with --expand (has 180s timeout, supports TOON format for 40% token savings)
- Use this tool for CLI commands without query equivalent: field ls, field history, interaction ls, saved-view ls, etc.

Key concepts:
- Entities (Company, Person, Opportunity): Global CRM records. Use 'company ls', 'person ls' to search ALL entities.
- Lists: Collections with custom fields. Use 'list export <name>' to get entries from a specific list.
- To filter by list-specific fields (Status, Stage, etc.), use 'list export', NOT 'company ls'.

Getting field values:
- Default list export returns only basic columns (listEntryId, entityType, entityId, entityName)
- Use --field for each custom field you need: list export Dealflow --field "Team Member" --field "Owner"
- --saved-view can be combined with --field for server-side filtering + explicit field selection

Examples:
- field ls --list-id Dealflow (see list fields and dropdown options)
- interaction ls --type all --company-id 12345 (all interaction types; --days or --after optional)
- person get john@example.com
- saved-view ls --list-id Dealflow

Filter syntax: 'field op "value"' where op is = != =~ (contains) =^ (starts) =$ (ends) > < >= <=

command.description: CLI command path (e.g., 'person get', 'company ls', 'list export'). Use discover-commands to find available commands.

argv.description: Command arguments as array. Include IDs as first element, then flags. Example: ['12345', '--filter', 'Status=Active', '--limit', '50']

maxOutputBytes.description: Maximum output size in bytes (default 50000). Larger outputs are truncated with truncated=true marker. Use --limit flag to reduce output size.

dryRun.description: If true, return the command that would be executed without running it. Useful for verification.
